Description: Decorative patch for a shoe, consisting of two layers. The third layer is the upper’s leather. The design of the dorsal-most layer is cut out in its entirety and secured onto the other layer with running stitches. The edge of the open work layer, however, is secured differently, with loops at the back. The element would have been applied to the top of a shoe.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Curator's comments: For shoes with decorative patches, cf., EA 53917, 1914,0902.3, EA 53918, G&R 1914,0902.5, Russo 2008, no. 14 and Griffith Institute Archive J. de M. Johnson excavation photograph (O’Connell, forthcoming, fig. 109). For decorative patches, see Griffith Institute Archive J. de M. Johnson excavation photograph (O’Connell, forthcoming, fig. 110). O’Connell, Elisabeth R. Forthcoming. John de Monins Johnson’s 1913/14 Egypt Exploration Fund expedition to Antinoupolis (Antinoë), with appendix of objects, in Antinoupolis II: Scavi e materiali III, ed. R. Pintaudi. Florence: Istituto papirologico “G. Vitelli.” Russo, S. 2008. Campagne di scavo 2005–2007: Le calzature. In Antinoupolis I: Scavi e materiali, G. Bastianini and R. Pintaudi (eds), 439–70. Florence: Istituto Papirologico ‘G. Vitelli.’
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (28)
